abstract: For hedge fund magnate Kenneth C. Griffin, 2007 was the best year ever. His Citadel Investment Group emerged as one of Wall Street’s top opportunists, picking up the pieces of fallen peers on the cheap. With such deft moves, Citadel rang in 30 percent-plus gains last year, compared with with the industry average of 12 percent.
lead_paragraph: For hedge fund magnate Kenneth C. Griffin, 2007 was the best year ever. His Citadel Investment Group emerged as one of Wall Street’s top opportunists, picking up the pieces of fallen peers on the cheap. With such deft moves, Citadel rang in 30 percent-plus gains last year, compared with with the industry average of 12 percent.

headline.main: Citadel Said to Consider I.P.O. This Year
